posts.post_content:
I like her, but honestly the best strategy against Vraska is to just ... ignore her.  
  
Her +1 is really only very good against creature-heavy strategies, which should just act as though she's not there and gun for the player instead. WHen she does finally pop her -3 to nuke something, then send in a few of your guys to finish her off. If she builds to her ult, just block them or use something like [Electrickery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Electrickery) or [Golgari Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Charm).  
  
Against strategies that aren't as creature heavy, she's a bit more of a threat, because she can vindicate, build up to her vindicate again (and if you rely on a few big bombs you probably don't want to swing into her), and if she should ever get to her ult, a strategy that doesn't have as many blockers could be in real jeopardy. But if you're not playing a lot of creatures, you *should* be playing spells that can handle Planeswalkers, anyway ([Dreadbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dreadbore) is going to be extremely popular, I think).... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (10/3/2012 5:36:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
On the one hand, I like her. Definately got some interesting ability. On the other hand... Her + ability doesn't protect her. Creatures and burn and the like can kill her just as easily as if she wouldn't have that ability. Yes, creatures die, but that can even be an advantage for the opponent. Some creatures have powerful "die" triggers, or you want them in your graveyard for other reasons, such as scavenge.  
  
The -3 ability is great. But To use it even twice without her dying, you'd have to spend a total of four turns. That's a long time.  
  
And the last ability is pretty unique and interesting. But also less powerful than many other commanders ultimates.
posts.html:

Some creatures have powerful "die" triggers, or you want them in your graveyard for other reasons, such as scavenge.

The -3 ability is great. But To use it even twice without her dying, you'd have to spend a total of four turns. That's a long time.

And the last ability is pretty unique and interesting. But also less powerful than many other commanders ultimates.

Posted By: majinara (10/15/2012 5:24:39 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Salience: The damage from Rakdos Charm isn't combat damage. All Rakdos charm accomplishes against these little dudes is bolting their controller.   
  
This card seems better than it is on account of the fact that your opponent can usually just ignore it and then attack once you use the -3, but it's still nice and I really like that planeswalkers are starting to protect themselves more effectively than simply putting a chump blocker with no evasion onto the board each turn.
posts.html:

Posted By: admiraldanish (11/7/2012 3:44:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Etheral-Dunny:  
  
In short, yes and yes.  
  
Activating the +1 immediately gives her a loyalty counter (it's actually a cost, you might as well read it as: "Put 1 loyalty counter on Vraska the Unseen: Do..."). it has nothing to do with what your opponent does with his creatures the following turn.  
  
There are Assassin token creatures you can draw in boosters, but they are extremely rare, roughly as rare as getting Vraska. I've opened about 13 displays (!!) of RtR and drawn a total of three Assassins. This is because the rarity of the tokens is linked to the rarity of the cards that produce them. Vraska's Assassins and Utvara Hellkite's 6/6 Dragons are "Mythic", the 5/5 Trample Wurms are also "mythic" but you get about twice as many, as both Worldspine Wurm and Armada Wurm make them. Centaurs and Rhinos are dime a dozen, as they are made by commons (Centaurs by several different cards).

See it more as reusable removal than anything else. The +1 is basically useless so just use the -3 as much as you can and the +1 just to power her up so you can use the -3. The ultimate is nice but will never be practical.

Posted By: Lifegainwithbite (5/21/2013 6:50:44 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
If you think of her as planeswalker who sets there and controls the board, she's not the most powerful planeswalker. Her +1 though flavorful only gives her pseudo protection, and doesn't effect the board in any meaningful way. Her ultimate though really cool, the 3 1/1s aren't horribly difficult to deal with and you have a whole turn to remove them or and least shut them down.  
  
Now if you think of her of black, green vindicate for 5 mana, that also is a planeswalker, who can repeat the vindicate every three to 4 turns, or you can put a lot of pressure on your opponent with her ultimate, and possibly finish them off. If you activated her plus +1, if she's killed by creatures, your taking them with you.  
  
If you consider her a repeatable vindicate, with some bonus, you'll find that she is an awesome card.

If you consider her a repeatable vindicate, with some bonus, you'll find that she is an awesome card.

posts.post_content: Played against this card and Primal Hunter in my second round against a guy in Standard. They got Hunter out first, used his effect afew turns, with Growing Ranks out, while protecting his Hunter with two fogs. They than got out Vraska and thought to myself, that could cause a problem if unchecked. I threw a couple of creatures at it to only being chump blocked by his beast's. After failure, I went back to my decks first strategy and go Exalted. I slowly built up my forces to wait for Vraska to die off. The turn before they used Vraska's ult, they brought out a Kitesail and an Elixir of Immortality. My immediate thought was shit. Their turn came, they used the Vraska's ult, gave a kitesail to an assassin, used Elixir to get it back into the deck, than used Hunter ult and populated one of the Wurms (8 wurms in total). They attacked with their assassin on Kitesail only. Vraska in my opinion sucks when she is alone, so I'll put her at 3/5, but if you are able to combo her with another wal...
